text: Alison Maria Krauss (born July 23, 1971)Alison Krauss bio for Billboard.com. Retrieved June 5, 2006. is an American bluegrass-country singer and fiddle player. She is famous for being the leader of the band Alison Krauss & Union Station, and has produced albums for artists like Nickel Creek, Reba McEntire, and Alan Jackson. She has 28 Grammy Awards, more than any other female artist in history. ==References== Category:1971 births Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Living people Category:Singers from Illinois Category:American Christians Category:American bluegrass musicians Category:Country musicians from Illinois Category:American country singers Category:American folk singers Category:American pop singers Category:American violinists Category:American fiddlers Category:American mandolinists
title: Alison Krauss
